qas.question: What year was the constitution amended from the previous one of 1992?
The newer constitution divide power among what branches of government?

answers.text: the executive, legislative, and judicial branches of government

qas.question: How many years is one presidential term for?
How many total terms can a president be elected for?
Executive power is given to what person within the government?

plausible_answers.text: powers among the executive, legislative, and judicial branches of government

qas.question: What did the Constitution not separate?
Who had a presidential system of government?
What country does not have universal suffrage?

context: Until the military coup of 22 March 2012 and a second military coup in December 2012, <b7_0><b8_0>Mali<b8_0/><b7_0/> was a constitutional democracy governed by <b5_0>the Constitution<b5_0/> of 12 January 1992, which was amended in <a0_0>1999<a0_0/>. The constitution provides for a separation of <b6_0>powers among <a1_0>the executive, legislative, and judicial branches of government<b6_0/><a1_0/>. The system of government can be described as "semi-presidential". Executive power is vested in a <a4_0>president<a4_0/>, who is elected to a <a2_0>five-year<a2_0/> term by universal suffrage and is limited to <a3_0>two terms<a3_0/>.
